intro: Talinum calcaricum, commonly known as the rock talinum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent yellow center. Talinum calcaricum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
